Kebabs on Charcoal-
Ambiance-
Angaara is one of most famous restaurant having many outlets in the city specialised in Kebabs on Charcoal. Angaara has one of its outlet near Wipro Nanakramguda. Angaara is spread over a large hall area including indoor sitting with causal dining.
Food-
As Angaara is famous for its Kebabs, we placed an order for chicken kebab which was served with green pudina chutney and had 6 medium sized Kebab pieces. Chicken kebab was tasty but lesser in quantity. We also placed an order for Broasted chicken which was served with ketchup. Broasted chicken included 4 large chicken pieces which were very tasty and crunchy. Finally, we placed an order for Chicken Biryani which was very spicy and medium in quantity.
Service-
Service was average.
This place is simply awesome. Love the food and nice behaviour of the restaurant sraffs. Must visit place for non veg lovers(especially chicken)

Really bad service and worst food. The give you half of what they have promised. I had ordered chicken drumsticks and this is what I have got from restaurant. Worst service from zomato no response from support.
quality and taste and packing all are bad

Been here for Friday lunch with colleagues.It is full crowded as it was weekend but they will get you a table with in short wait time.The non veg and veg starters are very good,biryani was also superb.

The place is large the staff is polite and the prices are almost budget friendly. We had the fried chicken which was great and is a must try!
Other delicacies are the kebabs which were great and juicy.
pathetic food... nothing much to say... please don't waste your plans by coming here. really really pathetic. tasteless unhygienic washroom and some stinky smell from washroom spreads there.

Was here for a team lunch. Tandoori chicken and fried chicken were satisfactory. Chicken Biryani was good. Overall a good place for people who love kebabs.

I was here a couple of times with my friends, Budget saving and Pocket-friendly restaurant in the Financial District. Ordered Veg Corn Soup, Paneer Chilli, Baby Corn Chilli, Broasted Chicken, Chicken Drumstick, Schezwan Fried Rice, Hyderabadi, and Butter Chicken.
The Angara's my all-time favorite Broasted Chicken was Superb, Veg Corn Soup, Butter Chicken and Schezwan Fried Rice were good. Paneer Chilli, Baby Corn Chilli, and Chicken Drumstick were average.I would advise you to try the Broasted Chicken, Service okay and Ambiance is not up to the mark.
Service 3/5
Food 4/5
Ambiance 2.5/5
Value for money 4/5

good

A humbling experience, but tasty North Indian food. 
The seating and the ambience is average, this being a go-to place for a dinner at anytime. 
The service is rather appalling, make sure to order all the stuff together else you’ll have to wait. 
Being a vegetarian I tried the Paneer Butter Masala and Dal Fry which were quite good. Tandoori Roti and Garlic Naan were big disappointments. The starter Paneer Tikka was really yum and spicy. 
A hearty and heavy meal on Sunday evening. 😀

Food was pathetic, service was even worse. Better avoid even if find no other option. We ordered grill chicken, after 15 mins the bearer comes and tell us that it isn't available, the same happened with our next two orders ( tandoori and biryani). We had to settle out for roti & chicken curry, the curry was like the chef had put all the left over kebab pieces into the gravy, it was really a horrible hangout.

Got disappointed with this place. 
I ordered mixed fried rice and Hong Kong chicken. 
Though the quantity was more, the quality was not up to the par. 
Mixed fried rice was not properly cooked. 
To the management: please have a quality check. I like your food but it is degrading day by day.

Had been to this place for lunch with the team and really a big disappointment. Expected the food to be delicious and fresh but it was totally opposite looked stale and unhygienic. Even the spoons and folks were not available for the food. I returned few of the items but still got charged and owner was least bother about the service and hygiene and looked over confident hoping for next time we will again turn up there.

Been here for dinner..Worst food and pethatic service..ordered 999 family combo which was a waste of money.they served us the food (chicken 65 and rumali)cooked in the afternoom,chicken curry was like water with spices, biryani was overcooked with no flavour..staff are careless and rude..never visit again 😁😁

For some strange reason, they took it back and gave tangdi kabab.That kabab was also bordering on stale.
Then ordered Chicken Biryani hoping for some respite.It had a lot of jeera(not shahi jeera ).
It was terrible.
Then finally repented for not walking out when  I was served stale grilled chicken.
If only there was a "no star" to rate.

Worst Service, Food Quality Average.
We ordered Panner Tikka Masala, Roti, Raita, Panner Briyani
First He served Panner Tikka Masala without roti, After 15 minutes we brought Roti. Then After 25 minutes he brought Raita when we have already finished roti. Then we waited for another 30 minutes for briyani and finally cancelled the order when we didn't receive it.
Even worse is none of the waiters will bother to listen to you even if you call them. Even manager rude saying that we have more workload(when half of the restaurant was empty).

Worst place to have food, pathetic service and untrained staff. Avoid going to this place, you might end up spoiling your mood. 
Third class place.
